meanings.definition: A loud, sudden noise or blow.
meanings.sent1: The boff of the door slamming shut startled me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a loud boff when the hammer hit the nail.
meanings.sent3: The boff of the balloon popping made everyone jump.
meanings.sent4: The thunder made a boff that shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The boff of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: To hit or strike with a loud noise.
meanings.sent1: He tried to boff the nail into the wood with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally boffed her elbow on the table.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to boff the dough to make it smooth.
meanings.sent4: The boxer managed to boff his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter had to boff the stubborn nail into place.

meanings.definition: A successful or popular person or thing.
meanings.sent1: She became the boff of the school after winning the science fair.
meanings.sent2: The movie star was a boff in Hollywood.
meanings.sent3: The cake was the boff of the party, everyone loved it.
meanings.sent4: The new smartphone became a boff in the market.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was a boff in the sports world.
